column5: Definition

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products
column7: Note that any whole entity cannot be a biospecimen

column5: A document that is an affine projection to a two dimensional surface, of EM spectrum radiation or measurements of some quality of an entity or entities repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range (where the measurements are represented as color and luminosity on the projected  surface.)
column7: Modified from IAO image definition and document relationship.

column5: An item of hardware that is a part of another item of hardware.
A data product that is an aggregate of data items of the same type that have something in common. Averages and distributions can be determined for data sets.

column4: IAO:0000027|'part of' some 'space life sciences dataset'
column5: A set of related data (either written or electronic) and is a part of a dataset
NCIt Definition: A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
column7: "By this definition no binary files are documents (we assume they become dataset files in NGLSDA)"

column4: 'has participant' some biospecimen|'has participant' some institution|'has participant' some personnel|'has participant' some payload|'has participant' some personnel|'has participant' some subject|(fundedBy some program)|(generates some 'space life sciences dataset')|obo:OBI_0000066|prov:Activity|(managedAt some 'nasa center')|(uses some hardware)
column5: A coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data, with the ultimate goal of discovery or hypothesis testing.
Any document (electronic or written record) that is about an experiment process (limited to the conduct of the experiment)
column9: Refers to 1) the way a computer operating system is set up, 2) the total combination of hardware components that make up the computer system, or 3) the specific software settings that have been established for the system. A control panel or other platform that enables the user to configure the appearance, actions, and other usage preferences on a device. NCIT

column5: A physical, manufactured or otherwise processed object that is used in a scientific investigation or clinical activity.
A document that is about an item of hardware.  For LSDA, hardware documents include hardware design, manufacturing, and operations documents
An individual who conducts scientific research.  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements

NCIt Definition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization. CDISC Definition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization. MGED Definition: A contacts affiliation, e.g. university, research institute or business.
A federally funded facility where NASA activities are undertaken.
column7: This would include JPL and other federally funded Centers. Is that in line with NGLSDA usage?

column5: A document that is about a mission.  For LSDA, mission documents include mission personnel, operations, schedules, and other related documents.

The International Standard Payload Rack (ISPR) is a steel framework container that is designed and been adopted by the International Space Station (ISS) program to support efficient integration and interchangeability of space payload hardware, such as machines and experiment

column4: ('member of' some institution)|('member of' some 'nasa center')|'Homo sapiens'|(operates some payload)|person
column5: Persons employed in any field.
NCIt Definition: A regularly issued printed or electronic report describing a main topic of interest to its subscribers.
TBD
column7: Currently not in NGLSDA.  (Dan to review with John)

column5: Semantic Type: Conceptual Entity NCIt Definition: A broad framework of goals to be achieved. Semantic Type: Organization: NCIt Definition: The principal administrative organization responsible for the research conducted.
A document that is about a project.  For LSDA, project documents include project operations, schedules, and other related documents.

NCIt Definition: A printed or electronic work offered for distribution. MSH Definition: Copies of a work or document distributed to the public by sale, rental, lease, or lending. (From ALA Glossary of Library and Information Science, 1983, p181)  CSP Definition: copy or copies of a document offered for distribution; includes the preparation of the documented material.
Criteria or standards used for the determination of the appropriateness of the inclusion of subjects in clinical trials and other research protocols.

column4: (implements some experiment)|(implements some 'research investigation')|(investigates some 'research area')|mission|'planned process'|(uses some payload)
column5: Coordinated tasks and operations undertaken to meet a set of specific scientific or technical objectives, within clearly delineated time and location constraints.
column6: Modified from SMD Catalog definition of Mission

column5: The name applied to a plant, animal, or other organism, according to the Codes of Nomenclature, consisting of a Genus and species.
A type of document, physical or digital, comprised of data and/or analytical assessment related to a scientific protocol.
column7: Scientific documents can be referenced or included in publicationDocuments.

column5: Devices, manned and unmanned, which are designed to be placed into an orbit about the Earth or into a trajectory to another celestial body.

An entity of interest, either biological or otherwise. EXAMPLE(S): A human being who might be of interest because they are on a study, a sheep who might have experienced an adverse event, or a pacemaker that failed. An entity, either biologic or otherwise, of interest in an investigation. [Definition Source: NCI]

A bounded physical or digital representation of a body of information designed with the capacity (and usually intent) to communicate a particular subject, art, craft, technique, applied science and/or industrial service.
A person responsible for the overall conduct of a study
How long something or someone has existed; measured at launch/start
